title: Undergraduate Real Analysis
text:
Content coming soon. This page will include some proofs on sequences, limits, continuity, point-set topology, and foundational integration theory. The primary reference is Elementary Classical Analysis by Marsden.

Chapters

title: Tianqi Zhang
text:
I am an undergraduate at Emory University studying Economics and Applied Mathematics.
My interests include applied microeconomics and econometric theory, with a focus on causal inference, policy evaluation, and statistical modeling. At the moment, this site mostly hosts my study notes.
You can reach me at tianqi.zhang[at]emory[dot]edu or connect on LinkedIn.

title: Probability and Statistical Inference
text:
Welcome to my study notes on Probability and Statistical Inference, where we delve into foundational concepts in probability theory through the lens of measure theory. These notes aim to provide a structured journey that bridges rigorous mathematical principles with their practical applications.
This material is intended for readers with a solid background in undergraduate-level real analysis, including: - Sequence and function convergence and limits
- Point-set topology
- Integration theory
By following this text, you will explore topics ranging from fundamental randomness and sigma-algebras to Lebesgue integration and advanced probability concepts such as stochastic convergence and density transformations.
I hope you find this document insightful as you navigate the beauty and rigor of probability and measure theory.

Real Analysis: Measure Theory, Integration, and Hilbert Spaces by Stein and Shakarchi
